raw: THE REGISTERED DESIGNS ORDINANCE, 2000 CONTENTS CHAPTER I PRELIMINARY 1. Short title, extent and commencement 2. Definitions CHAPTER II REGISTERABLE DESIGNS AND PROCEEDINGS FOR REGISTRATION 3. Registerable designs 4. Establishment of Patent Office 5. Proceedings for registration 6. Registration of same design in respect of other articles, etc CHAPTER III EFFECT OF REGISTRATION, ETC 7. Registration of designs 8. Infringement 9. Exemption of innocent infringer from liability for damages 10. Cancellation of registration CHAPTER IV INTERNATIONAL ARRANGEMENTS 11. Notification as to convention countries 12. Registration of design where application for protection in convention country has been made CHAPTER V REGISTER OF DESIGNS, ETC 13. Register of designs 14. Certificate of registration 15. Registration of assignments, etc. 16. Rectification of register 17. Power to correct clerical errors 18. Inspection of registered design 19. Information as to existence of registration 20. Evidence of entries, documents, etc. CHAPTER VI SUPPLEMENTARY PROVISIONS ON THE LEGAL PROCEEDINGS 21. Certificate of contested validity of registration 22. Remedy for groundless threats of infringement proceedings CHAPTER VII POWERS AND DUTIES OF REGISTRAR 23. Exercise of discretionary powers of Register 24. Costs and security for costs 25. Evidence before Registrar 26. Power of Registrar to refuse to deal with certain agents CHAPTER VIII OFFENCES AND PENALTIES 27. Offence and penalties 28. Falsification of register, etc 29. Falsely representing a design as registered 30. Offences by companies CHAPTER IX MISCELLANEOUS 31. Power to make rules 32. Fees 33. Service of notices, etc, by post 34. Saving 35. Instructions from the Federal Government 36. Repeal THE REGISTERED DESIGNS ORDINANCE, 2000 Ordinance No. XLV of 2000 [7th September, 2000] An Ordinance to repeal and to re-enact the law relating to industrial designs WHEREAS it is expedient to repeal and re-enact the law relating to the protection of in
